alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 12 at 6:30PM EDT until July 12 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR EASTERN MORRIS COUNTY... At 629 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Victory Gardens, or near Morristown, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Dover, Madison, Florham Park, East Hanover, Lincoln Park, Kinnelon, Chatham, Boonton, Wharton, Rockaway, Morris Plains, Mount Arlington, Mountain Lakes, Riverdale, Victory Gardens, Succasunna, Succasunna-Kenvil, Parsippany and Pequannock Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 30 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 34 and 53. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
